title: Installation issue: cmake with intel compiler
body:
<!-- Thanks for taking the time to report this build failure. To proceed with the report please:

1. Title the issue "Installation issue: <name-of-the-package>".
2. Provide the information required below.

We encourage you to try, as much as possible, to reduce your problem to the minimal example that still reproduces the issue. That would help us a lot in fixing it quickly and effectively! -->

### Steps to reproduce the issue

<!-- Fill in the exact spec you are trying to build and the relevant part of the error message -->
```console
$ spack install cmake@3.17.4~openssl %intel@18.0.5

==> Installing cmake
==> No binary for cmake found: installing from source
==> Using cached archive: /mnt/lustre01/sw/sw-spack/var/spack/cache/_source-cache/archive/86/86985d73d0a63ec99c236aab5287316e252164f33d7c4cb160954a980c71f36f.tar.gz
==> cmake: Executing phase: 'bootstrap'
==> [2020-10-12-15:59:57.137000] './bootstrap' '--prefix=/sw/spack-rhel6/cmake-3.17.4-uko57x' '--parallel=16' '--no-system-libs' '--no-qt-gui' '--' '-DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release' '-DCMake_TEST_INSTALL=OFF' '-DCMAKE_USE_OPENSSL=False'
---------------------------------------------
CMake 3.17.4, Copyright 2000-2020 Kitware, Inc. and Contributors
---------------------------------------------
Error when bootstrapping CMake:
Cannot find appropriate C compiler on this system.
Please specify one using environment variable CC.
See cmake_bootstrap.log for compilers attempted.

---------------------------------------------
Log of errors: /mnt/lustre01/sw/sw-spack/spack-stage/k202129/spack-stage-cmake-3.17.4-uko57xizchl34lutjcq5xrdwno4rgl72/spack-src/Bootstrap.cmk/cmake_bootstrap.log
---------------------------------------------
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 6:
    './bootstrap' '--prefix=/sw/spack-rhel6/cmake-3.17.4-uko57x' '--parallel=16' '--no-system-libs' '--no-qt-gui' '--' '-DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release' '-DCMake_TEST_INSTALL=OFF' '-DCMAKE_USE_OPENSSL=False'

1 error found in build log:
  >> 6    Error when bootstrapping CMake:
     7    Cannot find appropriate C compiler on this system.
     8    Please specify one using environment variable CC.
     9    See cmake_bootstrap.log for compilers attempted.
     10   
     11   ---------------------------------------------
     12   Log of errors: /mnt/lustre01/sw/sw-spack/spack-stage/k202129/spack-st
          age-cmake-3.17.4-uko57xizchl34lutjcq5xrdwno4rgl72/spack-src/Bootstrap
          .cmk/cmake_bootstrap.log

```

### Information on your system

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->

```
* **Spack:** 0.15.4
* **Python:** 2.6.6
* **Platform:** linux-rhel6-haswell
```

<!-- If you have any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.) you can add that here as well. -->

```
compilers.yaml

compilers:
- compiler:
    paths:
      cc: /sw/spack-rhel6/gcc-9.1.0-3m75hc/bin/gcc
      cxx: /sw/spack-rhel6/gcc-9.1.0-3m75hc/bin/g++
      f77: /sw/spack-rhel6/gcc-9.1.0-3m75hc/bin/gfortran
      fc: /sw/spack-rhel6/gcc-9.1.0-3m75hc/bin/gfortran
    operating_system: rhel6
    target: x86_64
    modules: []
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
    flags:
      cflags: -O2 -g -march=native
      fflags: -O2 -g -march=native
      cxxflags: -O2 -g -march=native
    spec: gcc@9.1.0
- compiler:
    paths:
      cc: /sw/spack-rhel6/intel-18.0.5-rp2c2m/bin/icc
      cxx: /sw/spack-rhel6/intel-18.0.5-rp2c2m/bin/icpc
      f77: /sw/spack-rhel6/intel-18.0.5-rp2c2m/bin/ifort
      fc: /sw/spack-rhel6/intel-18.0.5-rp2c2m/bin/ifort
    operating_system: rhel6
    target: x86_64
    modules: []
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
    flags:
        cflags: /sw/spack-rhel6/gcc-9.1.0-3m75hc/bin/gcc
        cxxflags: -gxx-name /sw/spack-rhel6/gcc-9.1.0-3m75hc/bin/g++
        fflags: -gcc-name /sw/spack-rhel6/gcc-9.1.0-3m75hc/bin/gcc
    spec: intel@18.0.5

```

### Additional information

<!-- Please upload the following files. They should be present in the stage directory of the failing build. Also upload any config.log or similar file if one exists. -->
* [spack-build-env.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/5365621/spack-build-env.txt)

<!-- Some packages have maintainers who have volunteered to debug build failures. Run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mention them here if they exist. -->
@chuckatkins 

When adding `cflags` & `cxxflags` & `fflags` to intel compiler flags it shows

```
spack spec --install-status cmake~openssl%intel@18.0.5
Input spec
--------------------------------
 -   cmake%intel@18.0.5~openssl

Concretized
--------------------------------
 -   cmake@3.18.2%intel@18.0.5 cflags="/sw/spack-rhel6/gcc-9.1.0-3m75hc/bin/gcc" cxxflags="-gxx-name /sw/spack-rhel6/gcc-9.1.0-3m75hc/bin/g++" fflags="-gcc-name /sw/spack-rhel6/gcc-9.1.0-3m75hc/bin/gcc" ~doc+ncurses~openssl+ownlibs~qt arch=linux-rhel6-haswell
 -       ^ncurses@6.2%intel@18.0.5 cflags="/sw/spack-rhel6/gcc-9.1.0-3m75hc/bin/gcc" cxxflags="-gxx-name /sw/spack-rhel6/gcc-9.1.0-3m75hc/bin/g++" fflags="-gcc-name /sw/spack-rhel6/gcc-9.1.0-3m75hc/bin/gcc" ~symlinks+termlib arch=linux-rhel6-haswell
 -           ^pkgconf@1.7.3%intel@18.0.5 cflags="/sw/spack-rhel6/gcc-9.1.0-3m75hc/bin/gcc" cxxflags="-gxx-name /sw/spack-rhel6/gcc-9.1.0-3m75hc/bin/g++" fflags="-gcc-name /sw/spack-rhel6/gcc-9.1.0-3m75hc/bin/gcc"  arch=linux-rhel6-haswell

```
Continuing with installation:

```
2 errors found in build log:
  >> 6    configure: error: in `/mnt/lustre01/sw/sw-spack/spack-stage/k202129/s
          pack-stage-pkgconf-1.7.3-2txqvstb3nptmjcn5fzggmya6lzz3dwi/spack-src':
  >> 7    configure: error: C compiler cannot create executables

```

Any idea what I'm missing?

Thanks

### General information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mentioned any maintainers
- [x] I have uploaded the build log and environment files
- [ ] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
